sentences.english: GG: Come and see. Some became millionaires for hoarding garlic as a rare commodity.
sentences.chinese: 過來看，大蒜奇貨可居，有人以此暴富。

sentences.english: Four parents all embrace for a night sudden wealth, become famous for a night of by luck mental.
sentences.chinese: 四家長都抱有一夜暴富，一夜成名的僥倖心理。

sentences.english: Come and see. Some became millionaires for hoarding garlic as a …
sentences.chinese: 過來看，大蒜奇貨可居，有人以此暴富。

sentences.english: And so he's poured his money into the lottery, looking for his chance to get rich quickly.
sentences.chinese: 所以他把錢大把的用來買樂透，尋找一夜暴富的機會。

sentences.english: I am fed up with those rag-to-riches story.
sentences.chinese: 那些貧兒暴富的故事我聽膩了。

sentences.english: Come and see. Some became millionaires for hoarding garlic as a rare commodity.
sentences.chinese: 過來看，大蒜奇貨可居，有人以此暴富。

sentences.english: In a business like this you can make a lot of money, but you can also lose your shirt.
sentences.chinese: 做這樣一筆生意，你可能一夜暴富，也可能傾家蕩產。

sentences.english: Thousands of gold seekers traveled to the Yukon through Alaska hoping to get rich.
sentences.chinese: 幾千的希望暴富的淘金者穿過阿拉斯加到育空地區。

definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
